resources.string:
About the App 


Matina Flood Watch is an application that attempts to predict flood water levels in the different areas of Matina, Davao City in the event of flooding. Its predicting algorithm makes use of data gathered from the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration, the Davao City Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office, and the Wunderground and OpenWeatherMap APIs. These gathered data were fed into a machine learning algorithm that produced the predicting algorithm for Matina Flood Watch. 

This mobile application is a product of the undergraduate thesis, A Mobile-based Urban Flooding Water Level Prediction Application Implementing Machine Learning Algorithms, by Chynna Sevilleno and Ann-Louise Gaynor of the Ateneo de Davao University under the mentorship of Michelle P. Banawan, Ph.D.

The Developers 


Chynna Nicolette S. Sevilleno
 is a 4th Year B.S. Information Technology Student at the Ateneo de Davao University. She is an aspiring UI/UX Engineer with a love for Star Wars and Brooklyn 99. 


Ann-Louise K. Gaynor
 is a 4th Year B.S. Information Technology Student at the Ateneo de Davao University. She is an aspiring Backend Web Developer and a lover of animated films and series.
